Posts.Content: Checking in to say hello. Have been reading posts for a couple of weeks and finding helpful information. Husband's stats are below. We have a surgery date of 9/11 with Dr. Patel in Celebration, which is way too long a wait, but it is what they were able to give us. We have asked to be put on a waiting list for any cancellations and hope that something comes through. Nice to have places online to talk to others who have similar situations.
Posts.Signature: Husband's data: Born 1955 PSA 11.9 Biopsy 5/8/18; 10 of 12 cores positive, bilateral involvement, tumor extends into right periprostatic adipose tissue Gleason (4 + 3) 7 Stage T3a Bone Scan negative CT Scan negative

Posts.Title: New Member, Wife

Posts.Content: Thanks Chuck. Yes a 3+4 would have been nice. Right now we are trying to decide whether he should stay on the pre surgery Casodex prescribed by the surgeon , in light of the long time until surgery. It looks like no real long term benefit to him, but a real risk of side effects and problems. Probably will talk to the surgeon's office this week regarding our concerns.
Posts.Signature: Husband's data: Born 1955 PSA 11.9 Biopsy 5/8/18; 10 of 12 cores positive, bilateral involvement, tumor extends into right periprostatic adipose tissue Gleason (4 + 3) 7 Stage T3a Bone Scan negative CT Scan negative
Posts.Title: New Member, Wife

Posts.Content: Thank you all. We certainly will continue to research. We dug pretty deep before deciding on the surgery. After the frustration of finding that there really was no one proper, scientifically better than the others choice, we decided the one thing we could control was the quality of the treatment input into our personal formula. Since we have one of the worlds most experienced prostate surgeons within a couple hour drive, and since radiation requires a more complex team of folks who each have a role (mark the spots, calibrate the machine, issue the treatment), and therefore more variables, we decided on the surgery. We feel like it is the right choice for him even though every couple of days I still think about the options. As you all well know, there is no one answer, just a decision and plowing forward!
